noun.description: The provision of what is necessary for the health, welfare, maintenance, and protection of someone or something.
examples: the child is safe in the care of her grandparents

noun.description: Serious attention or consideration applied to doing something correctly or to avoid damage or risk.
examples: he planned his departure with great care

verb.description: Feel concern or interest; attach importance to something.
examples: they don't care about human life
I don't care what she says

verb.description: Look after and provide for the needs of.
examples: he has numerous animals to care for

abbreviation.description: Cooperative for American Relief Everywhere, a large private organization that provides emergency and long-term assistance to people in need throughout the world.

phrases: write to me care of Anne
If you are having similar problems do write to me care of Scotland on Sunday.
Eager suitors are invited to write Rowland care of her maximum security penitentiary.
he couldn't care less about football
Sadly, it didn't matter, since my friends and mother couldn't care less which one it was.
